hackathon-description-text: The iOS App Challenge is coming to SLO!  This is an awesome opportunity for you to learn Objective-C or hone your skills while competing for awesome prizes and having one-on-one time with Apple engineers.

hackathon-judges.judge-name: SLO iOS App Challenge Judging Panel

hackathon-eligibility: This competition is open to students in the California State University system only (which includes Cal Poly and other UC schools).
hackathon-requirements: Submit a working .xcodeproj, zipped up, to ChallengePost with your submission.  A logo or icon representing your app is also required as part of the submission.
hackathon-rules: The iOS Apps that are developed and submitted must meet these requirements in order to be eligible to win the contest and are subject to verification by the sponsoring organization:

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: 13" MacBook Air (128 GB) for each member of the team (up to 3 members)
64 GB iPad Mini (Wi-Fi) for each member of the team
64 GB iPad Mini (Wi-Fi) for each member of the team

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=California Polytechnic State University, 1 Grand Avenue, San Luis Obispo, CA 93405, USA
hackathon-location-address: California Polytechnic State University, 1 Grand Avenue, San Luis Obispo, CA 93405, USA
hackathon-description-header: WISH and ACM at Cal Poly are presenting the iOS App Challenge. You'll have a weekend to make an iOS app and Apple will have engineers on-site to answer your technical questions.
